sentence.Network_en: I behaved with a politeness which seemed to disconcert him.
sentence.Network_cn: 我礼仪周到,这似乎使他不知所措.

sentence.Network_en: The events about to occur will disconcert others but not you.
sentence.Network_cn: 即将发生的事件s会 搅乱别人而不是你.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语反义词 - 豆丁网 ... discommode 使为难>施恩惠 disconcert 使仓皇失措>安抚 discrepancy 矛盾>汇聚的行为.
discompose v．使失态，慌张disconcert vt. 使惊惶, 使仓皇失措, 破坏disconsolate adj. 孤独的, 郁郁不乐的
GRE 同义词总结大全 ... vandalize v． 肆意破坏 disconcert v 使困惑,使仓皇失措,破坏 clamorous adj. 吵闹的，喧哗的 |.
自考 《电子商务英语1》单词词组_百度文库 ... Distinct 清楚的明显的 Disconcert 使…不安 Distinguish 区分.

list.abs: for COSMOLOGISTS , it was like the brakes and feeling the car speed up , an exhilarating but disconcerting sensation that something wasn't working quite .对宇宙学家而言，目前的景况像是猛踩煞车，却感觉车速攀升。这是一种兴奋中掺杂了些许不安的情绪，因为事情似乎不太对劲。
disconcerted with 不满disconcerted look 神色不安disconcerting 令人难堪
Vto astonish or disconcert 使惊讶; 迷惑vt. 使吃惊；惊吓
if a speaker looks at you continuously when speaking , as if he tries to dominate you , you will feel disconcerted .如果一个讲话者不停地看着一当他说话的时候，仿佛他尽力提醒你，你将会感觉不安。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent. (in the sense 'upset the progress of'): from obsolete French desconcerter, from des- (expressing reversal) + concerter 'bring together'

entry.def: If something disconcerts you, it makes you feel anxious, confused, or embarrassed.

example.tran: 安东尼的怪笑让萨克利夫不知所措。

example.ex: The ambassador was clearly disconcerted by the British reaction.
example.tran: 显然，英国的反应让这位大使很不安。

sentences.sentence: "The constant attention of the young man confused her"

auth_sentence.content: Well, as the first working manifestation of the maxim "everyone's a critic", Gogglebox can disconcert your moral compass.
auth_sentence.res_content: Well, as the first working manifestation of the maxim "everyone's a critic", Gogglebox can disconcert your moral compass.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Well, as the first working manifestation of the maxim "everyone's a critic", Gogglebox can disconcert your moral compass.

sentences.cn: 耀眼的光射得她不知所措。
